oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Commemorative Ribbon, Lookout Post
Grand Army of the Republic, Lookout Post No. 2, Chattanooga, Tenn.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Red, white and blue ribbon with gold fringe, enamel badge showing handshake and crossed United States flags below.

The clasped hands on this Grand Army of the Republic commemorative ribbon signify reunion, possibly referring to the first Blue and Gray reunion of Civil War soldiers that took place near Chattanooga in 1889.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: United States--History--Civil War, 1861-1865--Reunions
The Persistence of Memory
